The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Since i have never took any land use class before, this class was very useful

10: Professor Shansky is an incredible teacher. She is incredibly knowledgeable and able to answer all of our questions as they come up in class. It is so helpful that she is currently practicing - it makes everything we are learning feel that much more relevant.12: This was perhaps one of the best courses I took at FES. I learned so much that was relevant and very valuable to the field I plan to go in to.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Marjorie is a lively and engaging professor, and she is extremely responsive to students' questions. Class discussions were always great.
Professor Shansky is a sweetheart. Always energetic and enthusiastic!

The open-ended discussion with Shansky. Extremely valuable environment to be comfortable to pose novice questions and really take a certain case apart and analyze it as a group. Great classroom dynamic conducive to learning that isn't about wrote memorization. Very useful approach and information.
Instructor was very approachable

The professor is engaging and enthusiastic, and fosters an environment for discussion that is helpful in gaining an appreciation for the subject of land use law and environmental planning. Her ability to use real-world current examples from her own work really brings the material together, and guest lecturers were both informative and interesting.
Marjorie was the best aspect -- she was enthusiastic, knew all about her subject matter, and was willing to share stories and examples that illustrated the cases.
Marjorie's willingness to answer ALL of our questions!

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The professor seemed quite biased and subjective in her explanations of law.
We got behind a bit on the syllabus, so it wasn't always clear which cases we would be discussing on which day.

The pace of class was too slow. More effort to work through the cases at a regular pace would have been helpful.More background material in basic legal and land use law fundamentals would have been helpful as well.
Syllabus needs a better organization

I learned a lot in this class and thoroughly enjoyed it, but I would have appreciated a slightly more organized approach to discussing the material. The syllabus for the class outlined a progression for subjects that would be covered, but in-class discussions were relatively loose and it was sometimes unclear when we were moving from one subject to another. Having case-based discussions in class was great, but I think it might have been improved by the addition of short lectures introducing each broad subject and providing some background as we moved through the topics.

If it relied less on cases and had more of a framework in which to read those cases, it would be better, I believe. More organization and clearer goals about what is covered each session would be useful, and would probably allow for a deeper understanding of the subject.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Very much so
Relevant

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am interested in open lands conservation and collaborative conflict resolution and this class complements both interests perfectly.
Part of my profession is to address the issue of urbanization and its stress on the environment. Therefore the course was very uesful

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To learn more about land use law.
To gain a baseline understanding of land use and environmental planning and gain familiarity with this angle of the policy process.
Same as under 17
I am studying sustainable land use and agriculture, so it was something I felt like I needed to know about.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: No. It was a disjointed class that did not maintain any schedule or structure.
Yes, I feel I gained a practical understanding of land use issues.
Yes.
Yes, very much so
While i would have benefited if the course dwelt more on land use information beyond case laws, i felt the course gave a good basics of the land use law and planning
YES! and surpassed.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I have learned so much from my colleagues.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I would not recommend taking this course because it was too disorganized.
Take it and enjoy Marjorie's wisdom and good humor!
Anyone interested in the environmental issues must take this class. But the syllabus may consider more land use provisions beyond case laws.
Take it!
